name: News & Analysis
description: Quality journalism and in-depth analysis from trusted sources

items.title: Global AI Regulation: A Comparative Analysis of US, EU, and UK Approaches
items.author: Technology Desk
items.excerpt: As AI regulation crystallizes across major economies, three distinct approaches have emerged. The EU's AI Act prioritizes risk classification, the US focuses on sector-specific guidance, while the UK emphasizes pro-innovation principles.

items.title: Central Banks Signal Coordinated Approach to Digital Currencies
items.author: Martin Arnold
items.excerpt: The Bank for International Settlements announced a new framework for cross-border CBDC interoperability. Seven major central banks have committed to aligning technical standards by 2028.

items.title: Climate Tech Investment Reaches $100 Billion Despite Market Headwinds
items.author: Ross Kerber
items.excerpt: Global investment in climate technology startups exceeded $100 billion in 2025, driven by grid-scale battery projects and industrial decarbonization. Europe led funding despite broader venture capital slowdown.

items.title: Semiconductor Supply Chains: Where We Are Two Years After the CHIPS Act
items.author: Aarian Marshall
items.excerpt: The CHIPS Act promised to reshape American semiconductor manufacturing. Two years in, new fabs are under construction but production remains years away. We examine the progress and persistent challenges.

items.title: The Future of Work Survey: Employees Speak on AI and Job Security
items.author: Zoe Kleinman
items.excerpt: A survey of 25,000 workers across 15 countries reveals complex attitudes toward AI in the workplace. While 68% see AI as a useful tool, 45% express concerns about long-term job displacement.

items.title: Tech Giants Report: Quarterly Earnings Season Preview
items.author: Emily Chang
items.excerpt: As Q4 2025 earnings approach, analysts focus on cloud revenue growth and AI investment returns. Microsoft, Google, and Amazon are expected to report record cloud segments, while AI infrastructure spending raises questions about profitability timelines.
